column1: Geographic tongue is a type of glossitis.

Glossitis is often a symptom of other conditions, such as: - Allergic reactions to oralcare products, foods, or medicine - Dry mouth due to Sjogren syndrome - Infection from bacteria, yeast or viruses (including oral herpes) - Injury (such as from burns, rough teeth, or bad-fitting dentures) - Skin conditions that affect the mouth - Irritants such as tobacco, alcohol, hot foods, spices, or other irritants - Hormonal factors - Certain vitamin deficiencies At times, glossitis may be passed down in families.
- Antibiotics or other medicines to treat infection.
